data.name: Standard grant
data.description: Grants are transfers in cash or in kind for which no legal debt is incurred by the recipient.

data.name: Interest subsidy
data.description: A payment to soften the terms of private export credits, or loans or credits by the banking sector.

data.name: Interest subsidy to national private exporters
Capital subscription on deposit basis
data.description: Payments to multilateral agencies in the form of notes and similar instruments, unconditionally encashable at sight by the recipient institutions.

data.name: Loan in a joint venture with the recipient
Standard loan
data.description: Transfers in cash or in kind for which the recipient incurs legal debt (and the resulting claim is not intended to be traded). Since payment obligations on standard loan are senior obligations, i.e. creditors are entitled to receive payments against their claims before anyone else, they are also referred to as senior loans.

data.name: Reimbursable grant
data.description: A contribution provided to a recipient institution for investment purposes, with the expectation of long-term reflows at conditions specified in the financing agreement. The provider assumes the risk of total or partial failure of the investment; it can also decide if and when to reclaim its investment.

data.name: Bonds
data.description: Fixed-interest debt instruments, issued by governments, public utilities, banks or companies, tradable in financial markets.

data.name: Asset-backed securities
data.description: Securities whose value and income payments are derived from and backed by a specific pool of underlying assets.

data.name: Subordinated loan
data.description: A loan that, in the event of default, will only be repaid after all senior obligations have been satisfied. In compensation for the increased risk, mezzanine debt holders require a higher return for their investment than secured or more senior lenders.

data.name: Preferred equity
data.description: Equity that, in the event of default, will be repaid after all senior obligations and subordinated loans have been satisfied; and will be paid before common equity holders. It is a more expensive source of finance than senior debt, a less expensive source than equity.

data.name: Non-banks non-guaranteed portions of guaranteed export credits
Common equity
data.description: A share in the ownership of a corporation that gives the owner claims on the residual value of the corporation after creditors’ claims have been met.

data.name: Acquisition of equity not part of joint venture in developing countries
Shares in collective investment vehicles
data.description: Collective undertakings through which investors pool funds for investment in financial or nonfinancial assets or both. These vehicles issue shares (if a corporate structure is used) or units (if a trust structure is used).

data.name: Reinvested earnings
data.description: This item is only applicable to Foreign Direct Investment (FDI). Reinvested earnings on FDI consist of the retained earnings of a direct foreign investment enterprise which are treated as if they were distributed and remitted to foreign direct investors in proportion to their ownership of the equity of the enterprise and then reinvested by them in the enterprise.

data.name: Debt rescheduling: OOF claim (DSR – original loan principal)
Debt rescheduling: OOF claim (DSR – original loan interest)
Debt rescheduling: Private claim (DSR – original loan principal)
Debt rescheduling: export credit claim (DSR – original loan principal)
Other foreign direct investment, including reinvested earnings
Securities and other instruments issued by multilateral agencies
Guarantees/insurance
data.description: A guarantee refers to a risk-sharing agreement under which the guarantor agrees to pay part or the entire amount due on a loan, equity or other instrument to the lender/investor in the event of non-payment by the borrower or loss of value in case of investment. Other unfunded contingent liabilities refer to other instruments that do not constitute a flow as such but may be also collected in future.

metadata.name: Finance Type
metadata.description: DAC/CRS transaction classification used to distinguish financial instruments,  e.g. grants or loans.
